title: Why are scientists proposing to warm up Mars, how will they do it?
content: Scientists proposed to introduce engineered nanoparticles into Mars' atmosphere to raise its temperature by 50 degrees Fahrenheit over ten years. These particles would enhance the natural greenhouse effect. The researchers believe warming Mars' atmosphere is a crucial step despite the planet's harsh conditions. They also stress the importance of studying potential unintended consequences, including the possibility of past or present life on Mars.
summary: Scientists proposed to introduce engineered nanoparticles into Mars' atmosphere to raise its temperature by 50 degrees Fahrenheit over ten years. These particles would enhance the natural greenhouse effect. The researchers believe warming Mars' atmosphere is a crucial step despite the planet's harsh conditions. They also stress the importance of studying potential unintended consequences, including the possibility of past or present life on Mars.

title: Watch: Female NYPD officer punched on face by 'repeat offender' at New York sidewalk
content: A female NYPD officer was assaulted by Ernst Delma, a repeat offender, on a Bronx sidewalk. The attack happened when the officer intervened in Delma's argument with children. She received facial injuries and was taken to the hospital. Delma was arrested and has a history of similar offenses. The incident raised concerns about criminal justice priorities.
summary: A female NYPD officer was assaulted by Ernst Delma, a repeat offender, on a Bronx sidewalk. The attack happened when the officer intervened in Delma's argument with children. She received facial injuries and was taken to the hospital. Delma was arrested and has a history of similar offenses. The incident raised concerns about criminal justice priorities.

title: UK govt mulls curbs on visas for techies to bring down migration
content: The UK government considered tightening visa rules for foreign IT, telecom, and engineering professionals to address high migration levels. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper requested a review by the Migration Advisory Committee, focusing on sectors heavily reliant on international recruitment due to domestic skill shortages. The report is expected in nine months.
summary: The UK government considered tightening visa rules for foreign IT, telecom, and engineering professionals to address high migration levels. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper requested a review by the Migration Advisory Committee, focusing on sectors heavily reliant on international recruitment due to domestic skill shortages. The report is expected in nine months.

title: ‘No excuses’: US & other mediators call on Israel, Hamas to talk truce on Aug 15
content: Leaders from the US, Egypt, and Qatar urged Israel and Hamas to resume talks on the Gaza conflict, emphasizing that only details of the ceasefire and hostage release need finalizing. Israeli PM Netanyahu announced that Israel's negotiation team will meet on August 15 to finalize the agreement details. Four or five areas of disagreement remain unresolved.
summary: Leaders from the US, Egypt, and Qatar urged Israel and Hamas to resume talks on the Gaza conflict, emphasizing that only details of the ceasefire and hostage release need finalizing. Israeli PM Netanyahu announced that Israel's negotiation team will meet on August 15 to finalize the agreement details. Four or five areas of disagreement remain unresolved.

title: Yunus to meet slain student’s family
content: Muhammad Yunus, the head of Bangladesh's interim government, will visit Rangpur district to meet the family of Abu Sayed, a student killed in police firing during anti-reservation protests. Yunus hailed Sayed, citing his bravery as a catalyst for the revolution. Former PM Sheikh Hasina's visit to protest sites but not victims' families faced criticism.
summary: Muhammad Yunus, the head of Bangladesh's interim government, will visit Rangpur district to meet the family of Abu Sayed, a student killed in police firing during anti-reservation protests. Yunus hailed Sayed, citing his bravery as a catalyst for the revolution. Former PM Sheikh Hasina's visit to protest sites but not victims' families faced criticism.

title: Passenger plane crashes in Brazil, killing 62 on board
content: A plane operated by VoePass crashed near Sao Paulo, Brazil, killing all 62 people on board. The aircraft, an ATR 72, was en route from Cascavel to Sao Paulo before crashing in Vinhedo. The cause of the accident remains unclear. Footage shows the plane spiraling before hitting the ground, causing significant damage to nearby buildings. Brazilian aviation records show that the plane was manufactured in 2010, and was approved to carry up to 68 passengers.
summary: A plane operated by VoePass crashed near Sao Paulo, Brazil, killing all 62 people on board. The aircraft, an ATR 72, was en route from Cascavel to Sao Paulo before crashing in Vinhedo. The cause of the accident remains unclear. Footage shows the plane spiraling before hitting the ground, causing significant damage to nearby buildings. Brazilian aviation records show that the plane was manufactured in 2010, and was approved to carry up to 68 passengers.

title: US, other G7 nations shun A-bomb anniv in Nagasaki over Israel snub
content: Nagasaki commemorated the 79th anniversary of its WWII atomic bombing, but the event was marked by the absence of the US ambassador and other G7 envoys due to the city's decision not to invite Israel. PM Fumio Kishida reiterated his promise for a nuclear-free world, despite criticism. US ambassador criticized the exclusion of Israel, calling it a political decision.
summary: Nagasaki commemorated the 79th anniversary of its WWII atomic bombing, but the event was marked by the absence of the US ambassador and other G7 envoys due to the city's decision not to invite Israel. PM Fumio Kishida reiterated his promise for a nuclear-free world, despite criticism. US ambassador criticized the exclusion of Israel, calling it a political decision.

title: Bangladesh interim govt takes shape, 27 portfolios with Yunus
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, assigned key ministries to various figures, including former foreign secretary M Touhid Hossain. Yunus himself took charge of 27 ministries, including defence and education. This new administration, formed through a student movement, announced no decision yet on its tenure length and aims for democratic reforms.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, assigned key ministries to various figures, including former foreign secretary M Touhid Hossain. Yunus himself took charge of 27 ministries, including defence and education. This new administration, formed through a student movement, announced no decision yet on its tenure length and aims for democratic reforms.

King Charles' message amid far-right riots; 741 arrested, 302 charged, says UK police
content: King Charles has called for mutual respect and understanding following far-right riots in the UK targeting Muslims and migrants. The king thanked police and emergency services for their efforts. Over 700 arrests have been made, with charges filed against 302 individuals. Authorities remain on high alert for potential further unrest.
summary: King Charles has called for mutual respect and understanding following far-right riots in the UK targeting Muslims and migrants. The king thanked police and emergency services for their efforts. Over 700 arrests have been made, with charges filed against 302 individuals. Authorities remain on high alert for potential further unrest.

title: JD Vance reveals how he lost 30 pounds in 2 years: He changed this meal
content: ​JD Vance's before and after photos reveal a great weight loss journey but the GOP vice presidential candidate said it was all natural and he did not take any drugs or medicine for weight loss. Two years ago, Vance embarked on this 'eat less and eat better' journey when he was out of breath while playing with his children. Vance told DailyMail that the election campaign may derail his diet and exercise regime and he may regain the weight he lost.
summary: ​JD Vance's before and after photos reveal a great weight loss journey but the GOP vice presidential candidate said it was all natural and he did not take any drugs or medicine for weight loss. Two years ago, Vance embarked on this 'eat less and eat better' journey when he was out of breath while playing with his children. Vance told DailyMail that the election campaign may derail his diet and exercise regime and he may regain the weight he lost.

title: Man who attacked police at the US Capitol with poles gets 20 years, one of longest January 6 sentences
President Joe Biden, Vice President Kamala Harris to make first joint trip since Biden dropped out
Old video of Kamala Harris struggling to charge electric vehicle viral: 'This is real'
content: As the presidential election campaign is at its peak with both Trump and Harris camps digging the dirt, an old video of Kamala Harris struggling to charge an electric vehicle is viral. The video dates back to 2021 when Harris was speaking with reporters at the Brandywine Maintenance Facility in Prince George's County. During the demonstration, she appeared flabbergasted charging the car.
summary: As the presidential election campaign is at its peak with both Trump and Harris camps digging the dirt, an old video of Kamala Harris struggling to charge an electric vehicle is viral. The video dates back to 2021 when Harris was speaking with reporters at the Brandywine Maintenance Facility in Prince George's County. During the demonstration, she appeared flabbergasted charging the car.

title: Woman's body found entangled in baggage conveyer belt at US airport

Naked US teacher saves girl from being sexually assaulted, watch
content: A middle school teacher in Texas saved a 15-year-old girl from an attacker in a gated Houston apartment complex. The incident occurred around midnight on July 28. David Garza, the teacher, responded to the girl's cries for help by confronting the assailant with a gun, preventing a potential sexual assault. Authorities are seeking public assistance to identify the suspect.
summary: A middle school teacher in Texas saved a 15-year-old girl from an attacker in a gated Houston apartment complex. The incident occurred around midnight on July 28. David Garza, the teacher, responded to the girl's cries for help by confronting the assailant with a gun, preventing a potential sexual assault. Authorities are seeking public assistance to identify the suspect.

title: Passenger plane crashes in Brazil’s Sao Paulo
content: A passenger plane carrying 62 people has crashed on the outskirts of São Paulo, Brazil, according to the country’s Civil Defense, CNN Brasil reports, hitting multiple houses. All 62 were dead but there was no casualty in the houses that were hit by the falling plane. Shocking visuals of how the plane lost altitude when it was cruising at 17,000 feet emerged. In 10 seconds, the plane dropped approximately 250 feet. Then it climbed 400 feet in eight seconds. After eight seconds, it lost under 2,000 feet and then it began descending.
summary: A passenger plane carrying 62 people has crashed on the outskirts of São Paulo, Brazil, according to the country’s Civil Defense, CNN Brasil reports, hitting multiple houses. All 62 were dead but there was no casualty in the houses that were hit by the falling plane. Shocking visuals of how the plane lost altitude when it was cruising at 17,000 feet emerged. In 10 seconds, the plane dropped approximately 250 feet. Then it climbed 400 feet in eight seconds. After eight seconds, it lost under 2,000 feet and then it began descending.

title: Rare Tornado warning issued for US Capitol; Washington DC put on shelter-in-place alert; Airport delays
